comments.author: japaneselibrarian

comments.text:
Harmony Korine and Val Kilmer demonstrate the joys of true perceptive 
movement in hilarious mannerisms - absurdly portrayed makes it all the 
better. They wipe the floor of the other two filmmakers, although I did 
enjoy the second one a bit. ﻿
comments.author: Roger Ingraham

comments.text:
I thought it was really cool for some reason. Val Kilmer is a damn good 
actor to pull this one off. He might have to be a little weird himself to 
play a character like this(I know he plays himself)but the good kind of 
weird. "Cotton Candy!" haha fucking awesome.﻿
comments.author: George Dube

comments.text:
This is so retarded. Just a movie with bad logic and stupid content.
Hey, if you wanna know the "4th dimension" get to the "4th spatial 
dimension" and forget about the 4th direction is the time because they 
don't know what it should've been, because in our 3d world you can't move 
in the 4th direction.
It's not so complicated to learn about the 4th dimension.
6th dimension is a little same, but it's easy if you've already learned 
about 4th dimension.

If you go into a larger dimension than 6th dimension it's more complicated.﻿
comments.author: Anastasia Dunbar

comments.text:
I watched 4:20 of this film .....I think i will watch the rest when I get 
to another dimension ,.....CRAP CRAP CRAP ﻿
comments.author: Anna X

comments.text: funny
comments.author: Kuba Garbacz

comments.text:
This video angered me in a way that it shouldn't have. The most basic 
research or a college education in physics or mathematics will inform you 
enough. A dimension is defined many ways, perhaps the easiest to understand 
being the number of numbers you need to define a specific point in that 
dimension, for example, you need 3 numbers to define a point in 3D, and you 
need 4 numbers to locate a specific point in 4D. Dimensions are not 'planes 
of existence' or any of the nonsense spouted on this video.﻿
comments.author: vdeave

comments.text: what a piece of shit﻿
comments.author: hpotter4getbac

comments.text:
I liked the first one because I enjoy Harmony Korine's take on things... 
his film played so well into the "real or fake" aspect described in the 
intro. The other two were good as well, I just love how overt and simple 
the concept was on face in the first film. Visually all three were great. ﻿
comments.author: DickMcGuffin

comments.text:
Harmony Korine is a real fucking artist and his added portion to this movie 
is one of my faves. ﻿
comments.author: commoditiebooking

comments.text:
The simplest way to understand the 4th dimension. Take a point, add another 
point to form a line. Add another line perpendicular to the first. Add 
another line perpendicular to the other two, then add another line 
perpendicular to the other 3. This can be represented mathematically, but 
as humans we can't perceive it.

This video is quite stupid, there is no deep meaning behind it. Everyone 
here is probably high.﻿
comments.author: Pragmatic Puppy

comments.text:
The message that I gathered from this is that the fourth dimension, or 
time, is relevant to each of us. Whether you're spending it making peoples 
lives better like val kilmer, wasting it by analyzing it, like the russian 
scientist, or enjoying it like the four friends. Time is here to be 
experienced.﻿
comments.author: ray king

comments.text:
This is awesome. If your open minded you will deff see the point. Great 
movie. ﻿
comments.author: bill1204

comments.text:
Очень понравился этот фильм! Заставляет задуматься о действительно важных 
вещах! Спасибо!﻿
comments.author: Alina Minkau

comments.text: Ok, why is Kilmer dressed like Sam Kennison? funny shit.﻿
comments.author: Dru Flo

comments.text:
There is 3 dimensional TIME just as well as 3 dimensional Space. To look 
out and see Past, Present and Future all existing simultaneously to each 
other. Let's take a visible object and place it in every possible position 
that a mass object can be placed in, all at (what seems to be) the same 
time.

As far as the arrow of time, there is no real arrow of time, though to us; 
it only appears this way because we're all trapped in the one side of time 
that flows in one direction (forward). It will require much more force and 
energy, to move backwards through the opposite direction of time.

Time is one thing, Space is another, Space-Time is another other and the 
4th Dimension is also an entirely different concept within itself (more to 
do with the connection of points on a shape and number of sides it then 
has). 1D, 2D, 3D, 4D and so on. One can always see the full picture from 
the outside looking in, but never see the full image from the inside 
looking out. 

Now what does this Stupid Ass Movie and Fuckin Cotton-Candy have Anything 
to do with Any of this??? NOT A DAM THING!!! LOL﻿
comments.author: Zamir Prod.

comments.text:
There aren't three dimensions of time for us, only one. Three spacial 
dimensions and one time. Past, present and future are not separate 
dimensions, if you think so then you either 1. Have watched that dumb video 
about visualising different dimensions and tried to look smart, whereas 
that video has been known to be wrong for a while, or 2. You have a wrong 
idea of what a dimension is. I'm sure a calculus or physics or linear 
algebra class will sort that out for you.

Blah, Blah, Blah & PU... -_-zZ
comments.author: Zamir Prod.

comments.text:
+Conventional Internet Puppy To that comment "Artists will never be in 
league with theoretical physicists and engineers"... That's a very stupid 
statement!!! You're funny!!! Just the fact that I am an Artist says a lot 
more about my level of higher Intelligence. Just because I'm gifted on the 
right side of my brain, doesn't mean I'm also not gifted on the left side 
and/or logical in my way of thinking and reasoning. BUT; even Albert 
Einstein quotes "Imagination is more Important than Knowledge!!!"

Yes, I'm an Artist, but what else am I??? Hmm... Let's see... I'm also a 
web programmer and write code (HTML, CSS, JAVASCRIPT, JQUERY, PHP with 
MySQL), I'm a Writer (stories, poems, so on...), born Film Maker & 
Animator, gifted with Math, Biology, Chemistry and an Inventor... I'm 
fascinated with picking things apart and putting them back together just to 
see how they work... All that and I'm only skimming the surface!

I don't know everything & hate to speak on something I know nothing 
about... so if I debate you on a matter, better believe that I know 
something about what I'm taking about on the matter. 

What do you do... I wonder???
comments.author: Zamir Prod.

comments.text:
+Conventional Internet Puppy PS... If all we think we know is nothing but 
mere theory (which it is since we have noway to full prove shit), than your 
estimations are just as useless as mind. The only difference is, I have 
enough BALLS to challenge the norm...
comments.author: Zamir Prod.

comments.text:
+Michael Pugh Non sequitur, if you distil thinking, it's all the same. 
Higher order thinking and cognition. There is no "deep thinking", in the 
end it depends on how much details you nitpick. Your choice in grammar and 
speech style also further help to describe the person you are which I must 
add, is quite hilarious. You are the one trying to prove your "theory" 
hence, you are the one that must provide the details. So yes, what I was 
saying probably did sound like gibberish, but that's mainly due to your 
inability to comprehend theoretical physics and ironicly, close mindedness 
to criticism. That and you just pulled out random percentages out of your 
ass again. Also your career defines you. Artists will never be in league 
with theoretical physicists and engineers which also explains the wage 
difference.

And please, don't respond unless you can come up with a solid coherent 
paragraph devoid of metaphors and analogies. It's like cancer to read and I 
will probably ignore it.
comments.author: Pragmatic Puppy

comments.text:

great thinker's most deepest thoughts, because they never had the 
capabilities to think outside their own cubical; further than every

Although no one knows anything to be 100% facts; 85% to 95% is still not 
operating on the level of fairy tales and make believe. Not just pulling 
shit out my ass... Please stop pulling shit out of yours!!!
comments.author: Zamir Prod.

comments.text:
+Michael Pugh Judging from your previous comments, everything is an 
assumption. Your thesis development was poor and is laughable. Even the 
topic of time travel is a disdain to the scientific community. Your various 
google+ comments also seem to be heavily influenced by subjective means.

Inventions and breakthroughs do not come from ideas alone, they are built 
on previous knowledge of the topic with a supporting thesis. If you like to 
throw in random quotes, so can others as "past, present, and future is only 
a stubbornly persistent illusion." which is true to a certain extent as the 
concept of time is a thing humans created in order for comfort. Time travel 
is not possible as there are many conflicting theories. But if you'd like, 
time dilation is. 

The "looking into the past" thing is merely just remnants of dead stars, 
whose radiation took x amount of years to reach us. You can look up at 
night and probably see things that are already dead since light is just a 
steady stream of electromagnetic radiation. It only seems that time exists 
since we are observers of our universe. 

You'd like to believe that theories come out of thin air, out of nowhere 
from someone's mind. But this just shows the ignorance of the general 
populace. "Theories" in the scientific community are often backed by 
investigations and research. The data accumulated through such means are 
then formulated into a hypothesis for further testing. And peer reviewed by 
the rest of the scientific community for any forms of faults.

You can't prove it and you never will. Everything you say and will probably 
say is mere speculation or simply copy-pasta from some dodgy article that 
you happen to stumble across. You should probably stop reading outdated 
theories and perhaps indulge yourself in something that's has been approved 
and applied to various things. General Relativity, Quantum Mechanics or 
Bosonic String theory. You claim you are an artist, hence your mindset is 
already different in comparison to those who indulge themselves in 
theoretical physics. In their eyes, you are not onto something brilliant. 
Just something humorous.
comments.author: Pragmatic Puppy

comments.text: Who said I couldn't prove it ass hole???
comments.author: Zamir Prod.

comments.text:
+Michael Pugh Unless you can prove this mathematically, stop pulling things 
out of your ass. Your theories are as useless as a religious zealot 
preaching in the open.
comments.author: Pragmatic Puppy

comments.text:
+MrTrax0r I know I'm mixing up concepts a bit, but only to give other ways 
of looking at things, but trust me when I say that I'm really not confusing 
anything my friend.

Why must we always be stuck on the way things were taught to us instead of 
looking at things in our own way?

How can anyone ever come to a real conclusion if he/she could never think 
outside of the box he/she was put in?

Why wouldn't Parallel Dimensions show a clear example of Time Dimensions 
(Have it ever occurred to you, that's why the word "Dimensions" is used)?

NO!!!

WHY NOT... Because it wasn't taught to you that way???

If a "Parallel Dimension" is not a Dimension of Time, Real-Time or 
Spacetime, what the HELL our they talking about by using that term then???

Skip a "Time-Line" and other Universes... To me; A Parallel Dimension is 
simply another side of reality of this same Universe. The only reason a 
Parallel Dimension can ever exist, is because of the many different 
directions Time can go into which then creates those Parallel Realities... 
all at the same Time. LOL

Furthermore; There is real new studies showing Time itself (Past, Present & 
Future) in our own so called Dimension having curvature to it. With 
Powerful enough Telescopes, Scientists are now claiming to see into our own 
Universes Past, Present & also (believe it or not) Future! It's so many new 
sides to Time and what it really is, that we can no longer think of Time as 
a straight line. Don't take my word for it though; We can always learn much 
more than we know and do much more research. Who's to say if any of this is 
all real in the first place???

On Another Note: To me, it's not always about what I learned (in school or 
elsewhere), but also about what I can teach myself, and/or imagine leading 
to (trying, testing, creating) new things. If you always accept another's 
discovery as full truth, you'll never discover your own truth. Did Einstein 
not say, "Imagination Is More Important Than Knowledge"?

As an Artist; I already believed that phrase to be true. Many times in my 
life, I proved several facts of being true, which started first, nowhere 
else but in my thoughts / ideas, within my mind first. Scientists do this 
all the time; It's called a theory. Seeing as if none of us really know WTF 
Time nor "Spacetime" truly is in the first place, we can all speculate. 
Don't I have a right to my own opinions and theories, just the same as the 
next thinking mind? I already know; they're no more intelligent nor less 
intelligent than I am and I may just be on to something brilliant. ;)
comments.author: Zamir Prod.

comments.text:
+Michael Pugh Your talking about multiverses, parallel dimensions, 
many-worlds theory,etc.., not time. I am familiar with the idea that 
a world exist for every possible choice and that this basically means 
things would branch out infinitely, so that a world does exist for truly 
every possible outcome. Again though, that has nothing to do with time. In 
your example, we are talking about other universes. You could in a sense 
call them other timelines, but it isn't time that is there defining 
property. Its the fact that you would be in another universe in that 
universes timeline.  Time would not be a property of that difference. In 
this example I think you are confusing these multiverses as being 
additional dimensions of time, when they are really in a complete different 
universe with its very own temporal dimension (its own 4th dimension, not 
an additional dimension to our temporal dimension)
comments.author: MrTrax0r

comments.text:
+Michael Pugh I already know what you're going to say to that. Before you 
do, let me include this... Past, Present, Future (TIME) is also Curved & 
not Straight. I don't feel like going into it further either. Just know I 
said that for a reason. Maybe later, I'll elaborate.

I do respect you're debate though my friend...
comments.author: Zamir Prod.

comments.text:
+MrTrax0r No... I think you're only looking at things One Dimensionally. 
I'll tell you what... I'll give you a scenario.

We all have free choice... Right? Well; within free choice there are also 
many different possibility of paths we can take. Who's to say that there is 
not an existing action or path for every known possibility that we can 
think of taking. If I turn left and walk west; I get hit by a car and die, 
but if I turn right to go east; I find a huge bag full of Money, making me 
rich and changing my life forever. 

On one side of Time; my loved ones are mourning while attending my funeral. 
On the other side of Time; those same loved ones, are so HAPPY, celebrating 
my BIG Winnings with me (hints the phrase, "Dimensional-Realities").

If we could observe Time from both angles brought on by two or 
more different choices, then that means Time also has more than One 
Straight line of Dimension. This is the same as looking at a Three 
Dimensional box on all six sides. You could never see the back side from 
the front, you must first flip the box around to see the other side. Don't 
just get stuck on Einstein's Spacetime theory. This is a new time. Open 
your mind.
comments.author: Zamir Prod.

comments.text:
+Michael Pugh I know what you saying, and I mean no disrespect by this: But 
what your saying is nonsense. Your analogies really have no relevant 
relationship to what we are talking about. We certainly have alot to learn 
that we still dont understand. However, we dont need to understand all the 
laws of physics and how the universe works, to know what time is. Time is a 
human concept, which is very well defined. We dont know a whole lot about 
how it works, why we only perceive its arrow in forward direction, and many 
other things, but to use your computer analogy, we dont need to know how a 
computer functions at the lower level in order to know what a computer is. 
I think you are confusing extra higher dimensions (those higher than the 
4;which really are impossible for our minds to comprehend) and not time. 
The concept and definition of time, WHAT TIME IS, is strictly a single 
dimensions inextricably linked to the 4D fabric of Space-Time that we 
perceive as reality. These other dimensions, which probably do exist, are 
not extra time dimensions. There are only 3 possible places along the time 
continuum. You can either be sometime in the past, the present, or the 
future. There is no other place to be in time. There is no extra possible 
dimensions for time to be represented in. That is what time is, there is no 
way for it to be 2,34, whatever, dimensions.
comments.author: MrTrax0r

comments.text:
+MrTrax0r If I may add one more thought: Once upon a TIME, there were many 
of the Western World who used to believe that the world was flat but later 
found out that they were all very wrong. Then people believed that our 
planet was at the center of the Universe (wrong again). My point is; Just 
because one thing may appear one way from one's perspective, doesn't mean 
that one's perspective reflects a correct reality. It only means that 
one's perspective is the only perspective one needs to survive. 

Many people use Computers; that doesn't mean that everyone using it knows 
how the Computer works. Let's leave the technicalities to the Computer 
Engineer. Know what I'm saying? :)
comments.author: Zamir Prod.
